comments.body: Since you've manually packaged the `license_file`, please submit an issue or a PR upstream to add the license file to the source distribution (probably through the addition of a `MANIFEST.in` file and appropriate entry. Then put the link to the issue/PR as a comment here as a reminder to check to see if the license is included in future releases so the local copy can be removed.
@synapticarbors the license is packaged in the GitHub repo, just not the PyPi source distribution. I need to make an issue on the repo for the PyPi distribution and link that in my recipe?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +39,43 @@  license_family: GPL
  # License file not packaged in pypi, tracked in https://github.com/openai/atari-py/issues/71
  license_file: License.txt
  summary: "Python bindings to Atari games"
  doc_url: https://pypi.org/project/atari-py/
